metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3933 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An integer overflow could occur when OpenEXR processes a crafted file on systems where size_t < 64 bits. This could cause an invalid bytesPerLine and maxBytesPerLine value, which could lead to problems with application stability or lead to other attack paths.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3933` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr22 - 2.2.0-11.1ubuntu1.8
openexr - 2.2.0-11.1ubuntu1.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openexr package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.0-11.1ubuntu1.8').
povray: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
